text: Theodore Samuel "Ted" Williams (born Teddy Samuel; August 30, 1918 - July 5, 2002) was an American professional baseball player for the Boston Red Sox. He was the last player in Major League Baseball to go past a batting average of .400 (40%) in a single season. Williams was born in San Diego, California. Williams died on July 5, 2002 from cardiac arrest in Inverness, Florida, aged 83. His head is cryogenically frozen.Ted Williams Frozen In Two Pieces, Meant To Be Frozen In Time; Head Decapitated, Cracked, DNA Missing CBS News ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2002 deaths Category:Deaths from cardiac arrest Category:Cryonically preserved people Category:American baseball players Category:Boston Red Sox players Category:Sportspeople from San Diego
title: Ted Williams
